Method Detail

setProperties

public void setProperties(char indentChar,
                          int num,
                          boolean isPsychoRigid)
Set the character to use to indent and if the indentChar is not '\t', then num represents the number of whites to indent. If the variable isPsychoRigid is true, then the indent level is strict and the indentation of a line doesn't depend of the difference the two previous. For example (with isPsychoRigid false): if a == 1 then -----if b == 1 then -----c = 1 ... If isPsychoRigid is true and num equals to 3 : if a == 1 then -------if b == 1 then ---c = 1 ... The user decided to increase the indent but the PsychoRigid mode says that the indent level is 3.

Parameters:
indentChar - the char use to indent
num - the number of chars use to indent
isPsychoRigid - for the psycho-rigid mode

setProperties

public void setProperties(char indentChar,
                          int num)
The same as setProperties in keeping the same psycho-rigid mode

Parameters:
indentChar - the char use to indent
num - the number of chars use to indent

indentDoc

public int[] indentDoc(int start,
                       int end)
Indent the lines of this doc containing start and end.

Parameters:
start - the start
end - the end
Returns:
an array of length 2 containing the new start and the new end of the indented text
